messages.content: What is batchImg-rembg for ComfyUI?
batchImg-rembg is a set of custom nodes for ComfyUI that allows for the removal of backgrounds from multiple images.
How do I install the batchImg-rembg nodes in ComfyUI?

To install the batchImg-rembg nodes, you need to clone the repository into your custom_nodes folder in ComfyUI using Git. You also need to install either 'rembg[gpu]' or 'rembg' to your ComfyUI virtual environment.
What optional models are available for batchImg-rembg?
The available models include u2net, u2netp, u2net_human_seg, u2net_cloth_seg, silueta, isnet-general-use, isnet-anime, and sam.
How do I use the optional models?
The optional models are downloaded and saved in the user home folder in the `.u2net` directory. They are used according to the specific use case for which they are designed.
What are some helpful node packs that can be used with batchImg-rembg?
Helpful node packs include ComfyUI-AnimateDiff-Evolved, ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite, and comfyui_controlnet_preprocessors.
What is the purpose of the rembg models?
The rembg models are used for removing backgrounds from images and for human segmentation.
What is the name of the default rembg model?
The default rembg model is u2net.
What is the purpose of the u2net_human_seg model?
The u2net_human_seg model is a pre-trained model for human segmentation.
What does batchImg-rembg use for preprocessing original images to depth, lineart, openpose images?
batchImg-rembg uses the node pack comfyui_controlnet_preprocessors for preprocessing original images.
What is the purpose of the silueta model?
The silueta model is similar to u2net but has a reduced size of 43Mb.
What source code is used for the u2net model?
The source code for the u2net model is from xuebinqin's U-2-Net repository.
What are Acknowledgements in the context of batchImg-rembg?
Acknowledgements in the context of batchImg-rembg are credits to other contributors who provided insight or code modifications for the project.
